intro: Bupleurum asperuloides var. laxum, commonly known as the slender Chinese angelica, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. The plant features slender, branched stems and finely divided, pinnately compound leaves. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in compound umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is often cultivated for its medicinal properties and ornamental value in gardens.
